Description: Net-sinker made of light brown to beige steatite, very uneven shape of the natural stone, rounded ends, at one end is the surface partly chipped off. Three grooves incised, two at the end, the completely preserved one is circumferential, the third groove is quite acentral and close to the end that is chipped off. It is not visible in all parts. Between this third groove and the preserved end is a fourth groove that is running horizontal between the two vertical ones. The surface is uneven but partly well smoothed.
